title: RCE in ██████ subdomain via CVE-2017-1000486
content:
Summary:
The application at ████████/ftn-Website/ uses primefaces 5.3 but not 5.3.8, making it vulnerable to unauthenticated RCE CVE-2017-1000486.
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Get the publicly available POC for this vulnerability here: https://github.com/pimps/CVE-2017-1000486
Execute: python primefaces.py ███/ftn-Website/ -c id
Success: uid=91(tomcat) gid=91(tomcat) groups=91(tomcat) context=system_u:system_r:tomcat_t:s0
Product, Version, and Configuration (If applicable)
primefaces 5.3
Suggested Mitigation/Remediation Actions
Update primefaces.
Impact
An unauthenticated, 3rd-party attacker or adversary can execute remote code on restsvr1.ftn.research.usafa.edu as the unix tomcat user. Note that this service uses a DoD IP, suggesting an attacker could potentially pivot elsewhere afterwards.
steps: Get the publicly available POC for this vulnerability from https://github.com/pimps/CVE-2017-1000486
Execute the POC with the command: python primefaces.py ███/ftn-Website/ -c id
vuln_description: The application uses a vulnerable version of primefaces (5.3, not 5.3.8), which is susceptible to unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) via CVE-2017-1000486. An attacker can execute arbitrary commands on the server as the tomcat user.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to exploit using a publicly available proof-of-concept (POC) script. The attack does not involve multiple components, complex interactions, or novel logic. It simply requires running the POC against the vulnerable endpoint.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves an unauthenticated RCE via a known CVE (CVE-2017-1000486) in a specific version of PrimeFaces. The methodology described focuses on authentication and authorization bypasses (AuthN/AuthZ) and IDOR vulnerabilities by manipulating user sessions and resource IDs within the same application. Since this RCE does not involve session or resource ID manipulation, but rather exploits a known vulnerability in a third-party component, it falls outside the scope of the described detection methodology.
